question:
In the context of computing, a ‘spider’ is a/an:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 04/02/2021 (Shift-II)
option_1: Program that catalogues websites
option_3: Hacker who breaks into a corporate computer system
option_4: Application for viewing websites
solution:
• Spider is a program that catalogues websites by crawling and indexing pages.
  • Search engine (Option b) uses spiders but is not itself the crawler.
  • Hacker and application for viewing websites (Options c and d) perform different functions and are not related to web crawling.

Additional Information:

  • Also known as a web crawler, it follows links recursively to discover new pages.
  • Search engines rely on spiders to update and maintain their indexes.
  • Spiders gather metadata such as page titles, keywords, and content summaries.

question:
GUI in the context of computer stands for:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/01/2021 (Shift-I)
option_2: Gigabyte Used in Internet
solution:
• GUI stands for Graphical User Interface, which uses graphical elements like windows and icons for user interaction.
  • It allows users to interact visually with the computer using a mouse and keyboard.
  • Modern systems employ GUIs in operating systems and applications to enhance usability.

Additional Information:

  • GUI contrasts with Command‑Line Interface (CLI), where users type text commands.
  • Popular GUI frameworks include WPF, Qt, and GTK.
  • GUI elements often comprise buttons, menus, and dialog boxes.

question:
A collection of interrelated files and a set of programs that allow users to access and modify these files is known as:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 13/01/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Database Management System (DBMS) is a collection of interrelated files and programs that allow users to access and modify these files.
  • It serves as an interface between application programs and the physical database, abstracting data storage details.
  • A DBMS provides data organization, integrity, and independence, enabling efficient data management.

Additional Information:

  • Examples of DBMS include Oracle, MySQL, and Microsoft Access.
  • It uses Structured Query Language (SQL) to define and manipulate data.
  • DBMS supports transaction management and concurrency control to ensure reliability and consistency.

question:
Which is not a web browser from the following?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 06/04/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Google is not a web browser.
  • Opera, Mozilla Firefox, and Safari are all web browsers.
  • Google refers to the search engine and company, not a browser application.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Google.

Additional Information:

  • A web browser is software that retrieves, interprets, and displays web pages.
  • Major browser features include tabbed browsing, bookmarks, and extension support.
  • While Google Chrome is a browser, the option “Google” alone denotes the search engine, not the browser.

question:
Which one of the following is defined as ‘a program that runs in the background on your computer, sending information about your browsing habits to the company that installed it on your computer’?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Spyware runs in the background on your computer, secretly sending information about your browsing habits to whoever installed it.
  • Adware primarily displays unsolicited advertisements but doesn’t necessarily transmit data covertly.
  • Malware is a broad category of malicious software, including viruses, worms, and Trojans.
  • Grayware refers to unwanted applications that aren’t outright malicious but can degrade performance.

Additional Information:

  • Data Theft: Spyware can capture keystrokes, passwords, and personal information without your knowledge.
  • Detection: Modern antivirus and anti‑spyware tools scan for behavioral patterns typical of spyware.
  • Removal: Complete removal often requires specialized anti‑spyware utilities and manual registry/setting cleanup.

question:
Which one of the following software applications is not a part of Microsoft Office?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 16/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Acrobat Reader is not part of the Microsoft Office suite.
  • Excel, PowerPoint, and Word are core Office applications.
  • Therefore, the correct answer is Acrobat Reader.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft Office Suite includes Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Access.
  • Acrobat Reader is an Adobe application for viewing and printing PDF files.
  • Office apps use formats like .docx, .xlsx, and .pptx, whereas Acrobat Reader handles .pdf.

question:
What is ‘UBUNTU’?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 28/12/2020 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Ubuntu is an operating system based on the Linux kernel.
  • It is a Linux distribution providing a complete desktop and server environment.
  • Free and open‑source, Ubuntu allows users to view, modify, and redistribute its source code.

Additional Information:

  • Developed by Canonical Ltd., Ubuntu follows a biannual release cycle.
  • GNOME desktop environment is the default GUI, offering a user‑friendly interface.
  • Strong community support ensures extensive documentation, forums, and updates.

question:
Which was the first web browser developed by the National Center for Supercomputing Applications?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 06/04/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Mosaic was the first web browser developed by the National Center for Supercomputing Applications (NCSA).
  • It was released in 1993 for Windows, Mac, and Unix, pioneering features like inline images.
  • NCSA Mosaic laid the groundwork for modern web browsers by demonstrating the commercial potential of graphical browsing.

Additional Information:

  • Graphical Innovation: Mosaic enabled images and text to appear together on the page, unlike earlier text‑only browsers.
  • Influence on Netscape: Its code and team led to the creation of Netscape Navigator in late 1994.
  • Legacy: Mosaic’s success spurred rapid growth of the World Wide Web and the browser industry.

question:
The trial test of a computer or software before the commercial launch is called:

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/02/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Beta test is the trial testing phase conducted after alpha testing and before commercial launch.
  • It involves real users testing the software in a real-world environment to identify issues.
  • Feedback from beta testing helps developers refine features and fix remaining bugs.

Additional Information:

  • Participant Selection: Beta testers may be selected publicly or from a pool of loyal users.
  • Duration: Beta tests typically run for weeks to months, depending on the project scope.
  • Release Impact: Successful beta testing increases confidence in the product’s stability at launch.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a type of desktop operating system?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/03/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Android is primarily a mobile operating system, not designed for desktops.
  • Mac, Linux, and Windows are all desktop operating systems.
  • Therefore, Android is the correct choice as it is not a desktop OS.

Additional Information:

  • Android optimises for touchscreen devices like smartphones and tablets.
  • macOS (by Apple), Linux distributions (e.g., Ubuntu, Fedora), and Windows (by Microsoft) run on personal computers.
  • Desktop OSs provide features like windowed applications, file system management, and peripherals support tailored to keyboards and mice.

question:
Which of the following is not an instant messaging application?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Google Chrome is a web browser and not an instant messaging application.
  • Nimble, Hangouts, and E‑buddy are all instant messaging applications.

Additional Information:

  • Hangouts is developed by Google for messaging and video calls.
  • E‑buddy is a multi‑platform chat client supporting various IM services.
  • Nimble combines CRM features with social messaging capabilities.

question:
Which operating company developed the mobile operating system software Android OS in 2007?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Google Corporation developed the Android OS in 2007 as a mobile operating system.
  • Android was designed as an open‑source, Linux‑based platform for smartphones.
  • It provides a flexible framework allowing manufacturers and developers to customise the user experience.

Additional Information:

  • The Open Handset Alliance, led by Google, publicly announced Android in November 2007.
  • The first commercial Android device, HTC Dream (T‑Mobile G1), launched in January 2008.
  • Android’s architecture enables OEMs and app developers to tailor features and UIs for diverse hardware.

question:
Which of the following is not a virus that infects a computer?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Norton is not a virus but an antivirus software.
  • Melissa, Trojan horse, and Love gate are all types of computer viruses.
  • Norton is used to protect systems from such viruses.

Additional Information:

  • Melissa virus (1999) was a mass‑mailing macro virus that spread via infected Word documents.
  • Trojan horse malware hides within legitimate programs and executes malicious code when run.
  • Love Gate (ILOVEYOU worm, 2000) propagated through email attachments, causing widespread damage.

question:
__________ is a software code that is used to fix the problem associated with the same program after installing the software program.

RRB NTPC Stage-I 29/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A patch is a piece of software code applied after installation to correct known issues.
  • It updates or replaces parts of the existing program without requiring complete reinstallation.
  • Patches can address bugs, security vulnerabilities, and performance problems.

Additional Information:

  • Developers release patches regularly as part of version maintenance.
  • Applying patches is essential to keep software secure and stable.
  • Patches may be distributed automatically through update mechanisms or manually downloaded.

question:
Which of the following is not an Operating System?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 10/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Pascal is a programming language, not an operating system.
  • Unix, Linux, and Bare Metal refer to operating environments or systems.
  • Therefore, Pascal is not an operating system.

Additional Information:

  • Pascal was developed by Niklaus Wirth in 1970 for teaching structured programming.
  • An operating system manages hardware resources and provides user interface and system services.
  • Bare Metal computing refers to running applications directly on hardware, often via minimal firmware or a lightweight OS.

question:
Which of the following options is programming software?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 12/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Q BASIC is a programming software designed for beginners.
  • A BASIC, R BASIC, and T BASIC are not standard programming environments.
  • Q BASIC stands for Quick Beginners All-purpose Symbolic Instruction Code and provides an interactive development environment.

Additional Information:

  • Developed by Microsoft, Q BASIC was first released in 1985.
  • Interactive Interpreter allows writing, editing, and running code line by line.
  • File Extension: Q BASIC programs typically use the .bas extension.

question:
McAfee is –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 18/04/2016 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Antivirus software designed to detect, prevent, and remove malware.
  • Real‑time scanning of files and applications for threats.
  • Threat removal capability to clean or quarantine infected items.

Additional Information:

  • Founded in 1987, McAfee is one of the oldest security vendors.
  • Cross‑platform support for Windows, macOS, Android, and iOS.
  • Automatic updates ensure protection against the latest vulnerabilities.

question:
Which of the following is used by a computer to convert a process oriented language program to a machine language program?

RRB NTPC Stage-II 18/01/2021 (Shift-III)
solution:
• Compiler converts an entire process‑oriented high‑level language program into machine language before execution.
  • Scanner, Plotter, and VDU are input/output devices and do not perform language translation.
  • Compilation enables faster program execution by generating optimized machine code.

Additional Information:

  • A compiler performs lexical analysis, parsing, and code generation in distinct phases.
  • Unlike an interpreter, a compiler translates the full program at once, not line‑by‑line.
  • Common compilers include GCC for C/C++ and javac for Java.

question:
Which one of the following is not a search engine?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 30/03/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A search engine is a software system that searches for information on the internet.
  • Yahoo, Bing, and Gigablast are all examples of search engines, whereas Flipkart is an e‑commerce platform.
  • Therefore, the one that is not a search engine is Flipkart.

Additional Information:

  • Flipkart is an online marketplace for goods, founded in India.
  • Yahoo is a web services provider known primarily for its search engine.
  • Gigablast is a smaller, open‑source search engine established in 2000.

question:
Which one of the following is not related to this group?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 31/03/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Group comprises mobile operating systems.
  • Android, Bada, and Symbian are all mobile OS.
  • DOS is a PC operating system, not a mobile OS.

Additional Information:

  • DOS stands for Disk Operating System, developed by Microsoft.
  • Android is based on the Linux kernel and developed by Google.
  • Symbian was created by the Symbian Foundation for smartphones.

question:
UNIX operating system is a trademark of –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• UNIX is a multitasking, multiuser operating system originally developed at Bell Laboratories.
  • The trademark for the term “UNIX” is owned by Bell Laboratories.
  • Therefore, the correct option is Bell Laboratory.

Additional Information:

  • Microsoft and Apple are not associated with the UNIX trademark.
  • Motorola is a hardware manufacturer, not the trademark holder for UNIX.
  • Bell Labs continue to manage the UNIX intellectual property under license.

question:
Which of the following is not an example of word processor?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 02/04/2016 (Shift-II)
solution:
• A word processor is a software application designed to create, edit, and format text documents.
  • IBM Lotus Symphony, Microsoft Word, and Google Docs are all word processors.
  • Microsoft Excel is a spreadsheet application, not a word processor.

Additional Information:

  • IBM Lotus Symphony was developed by Lotus Software, now owned by IBM.
  • Google Docs is a cloud‑based word processing tool.
  • Microsoft Excel is primarily used for data analysis and spreadsheets.

question:
Yosemite, Mavericks, Mountain Lion, Snow Leopard, Leopard, Tiger Panther, Jaguar, Puma and Chita in a computer system is referred to as –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 03/04/2016 (Shift-II)
option_1: Mac OS X Sons
solution:
• Yosemite, Mavericks, Mountain Lion, Snow Leopard, Leopard, Tiger, Panther, Jaguar, Puma and Cheetah are all codenames for Apple’s Mac OS X releases.
  • These codenames denote different versions of the Mac OS X operating system.
  • Therefore, they are referred to as Mac OS X Sons.

Additional Information:

  • Apple initially used big cats (e.g. Tiger, Panther, Jaguar) as its codenames.
  • Starting with Mavericks, Apple shifted to California landmark names (e.g. Yosemite).
  • Each codename corresponds to a specific major release of Mac OS X.

question:
In the context of applet computing is –

RRB NTPC Stage-I 17/01/2017 (Shift-III)
solution:
• An applet is a small Java application designed to run within a web browser.
  • It is not a computer virus.
  • It is not a firewall or a kryphin.

Additional Information:

  • Java applets operate in a sandbox environment for security.
  • They require a Java-enabled browser or plugin to execute.
  • Modern web standards (e.g., HTML5) have largely replaced applets.

question:
A software user interface feature that allows the user to view anything with the end result when the document is being prepared –

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• WYSIWYG stands for “What You See Is What You Get”, a feature in user interfaces.
  • It allows users to view the document on‑screen exactly as it will appear when printed or finalised.
  • Therefore, the correct option is WYSIWYG.

Additional Information:

  • Format builder and Format fidelity are not standard UI feature names.
  • WYGYWAS is a non‑standard, incorrect acronym.
  • WYSIWYG editors are common in word processors, web design tools, and desktop publishing software.

question:
Machine language –

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
option_1: Is the one in which the first programs were written
option_2: Is the only language that a computer understands
option_3: One type of computer language which is different from another type
solution:
• Machine language is the only language that a computer’s hardware can directly understand.
  • It is composed of binary code (0s and 1s) that represent low‑level instructions.
  • Higher‑level languages must be translated into machine language via assemblers or compilers.

Additional Information:

  • Machine language is the first‑generation programming language.
  • Its binary format makes it difficult to write and debug.
  • Each CPU architecture has its own unique machine language instruction set.

question:
In a computer, assembler is –

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
option_1: A program that prepares the program in memory to operate it
option_2: A program that mechanically translates the assembly language into machine
option_3: A program that accepts a program written in higher language and creates an object program
option_4: A program that appears to operate the source program
solution:
• An assembler is a program that mechanically translates assembly language into machine code.
  • It converts mnemonic instructions into their corresponding binary op‑codes.
  • Therefore, option (b) accurately describes the assembler’s role.

Additional Information:

  • Assemblers produce an object program, which is often linked before execution.
  • They handle symbol resolution and address assignment during translation.
  • Assemblers differ from compilers, which translate high‑level language code.

question:
Which of this software is used to manage a large number of activities of a civil engineering project?

RRB SSE 21/12/2014
solution:
• MS Project is a project management software designed to handle large-scale project activities.
  • It is widely used in civil engineering and other industries for scheduling and resource allocation.
  • Therefore, the software used is MS Project.

Additional Information:

  • MS Project allows creation of Gantt charts, task lists, and resource histograms.
  • It supports cost management, time tracking, and collaboration.
  • Alternatives like MS Eng, SQL Project, or dBase Project are not standard project management tools.

question:
In computer software, what is called software that transfers object programs from secondary memory to main memory –

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• A linker combines multiple object programs by resolving symbol references to produce a single executable module.
  • It prepares the program for loading by fixing addresses and merging code segments.
  • In this question’s context, the linker is identified as the software that readies object code for transfer (exam convention).

Additional Information:

  • A loader (option b) actually transfers the executable module from secondary to main memory.
  • An assembler (option a) translates assembly language into object code.
  • Task Builder (option d) is not a standard term in this process.

question:
Which of these is not DBMS software?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• COBOL is a programming language, not a database management system.
  • Oracle, Sybase, and SQL Server are all DBMS software.
  • Therefore, the one that is not DBMS software is COBOL.

Additional Information:

  • Oracle is a widely used relational DBMS developed by Oracle Corporation.
  • Sybase was an early enterprise DBMS, now part of SAP.
  • SQL Server is Microsoft’s relational database product.

question:
Which of the following is a graphical web browser based on the WebKit browser engine?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/07/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• Safari is a graphical web browser.
  • It is built on the WebKit browser engine.
  • The other options are graphics/design software, not web browsers.

Additional Information:

  • WebKit is an open‑source layout engine originally developed by Apple.
  • Safari ships as the default browser on macOS and iOS.
  • WebKit’s technology underpinned early versions of Google Chrome (later forked into Blink).

question:
Which of the following is a computer programming language?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 26/07/2021 (Shift-II)
solution:
• Scratch is a block-based programming language developed by MIT.
  • UNIX is an operating system, Norton is utility software, and BOSS is an Indian Linux distribution.
  • Therefore, the programming language among the options is Scratch.

Additional Information:

  • Scratch lets users create programs by drag‑and‑drop code blocks.
  • It’s widely used as an introductory language in schools and by beginner programmers.
  • Scratch projects run on the Scratch website or via the desktop Scratch application.

question:
Which of the following is the correct software used for Word processing?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• MS Word is the correct software used for word processing , such as creating, editing, formatting, and printing text documents.
  • It supports tools like spell check, grammar check, page layout, styles, and templates.
  • MS Word is part of the Microsoft Office Suite and is widely used for personal and professional document creation.

Additional Information:

  • MS Excel is used for spreadsheets and data analysis.
  • MS PowerPoint is used for creating presentations.
  • MS Access is used for managing databases.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a word processing package?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Adobe Photoshop is a graphics editing software , not a word processing tool.
  • It is primarily used for photo editing, digital art, and image manipulation , not for creating or editing text documents.
  • The other options— MS Word , Apple Pages , and Google Docs —are all genuine word processing packages used to create, edit, and format documents.

Additional Information:

  • Word processing software typically includes tools for text formatting, spell check, page layout , and document sharing .
  • Photoshop does allow for text layers but is not meant for document creation or formatting.

question:
Category of software for word processing, DBMS, spreadsheets

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Application software provides end-user functionality such as word processing , database management , graphic manipulation , and spreadsheet creation .
  • These programs run on top of the operating system to perform specific tasks for users.
  • Examples include Microsoft Office , Adobe Photoshop , and MySQL Workbench .

Additional Information:

  • System software (e.g., operating systems) manages hardware and provides core services, not user-facing productivity tools.
  • A Framework is a code library for developers, not a standalone application suite.
  • Structure is not a recognized category of software in standard classifications.
